column9: Set Up and Gameplan / Final Meetings for Volunteers/Staff
Doors Open + Ladybird Tacos + Prickly Pear Coffee - Delivered 7:30am

column15: The pursuit of monetizing the megawatt has matured from isolated experiments into a diverse, global practice. Bitcoin miners now operate across oil fields, residential heating systems, and grid-scale facilities, demonstrating mastery of curtailment and energy arbitrage. Yet the conversation no longer belongs to miners alone. The entry of artificial intelligence, HPC workloads, and innovative generation sources signals an expanded ecosystem of large-scale energy consumers. This report argues for widening the tent: by engaging cross-industry dialogue, miners, technologists, and new power producers can collectively advance methods for capturing value from energy in ways that drive efficiency, resilience, and market-driven innovation.

column9: How SMR and Nuclear Turn Atoms to Algorithms
column15: We explore an emerging synergy between nuclear power, especially in small modular reactors (SMRs), and energy-hungry computing. As energy entrepreneurs develop and deploy new nuclear and SMR projects, co-located Bitcoin mines and data centers can serve as constant offtake, monetizing the reactor’s output. We discuss pilot projects where “always-on” atomic energy powers AI supercomputers and mining farms, how SMRs might one day enable decentralized compute hubs, and what policies or partnerships are needed to realize a nuclear-powered digital future.

column9: Bridging Policy, Academia, and Industry: Accelerating Nuclear Energy Innovation
column12: Hash Hashemian (National President of American Nuclear Society)
column15: Tennessee Electric Cooperative Association SVP, Justin Maierhofer and National President of American Nuclear Society, Hash Hashemian explore the necessary synergies between policy, academic coursework, research, and industry expertise in accelerating American nuclear innovation. Drawing on experiences in high level government relations and public affairs and decades of work in nuclear instrumentation advancements, they discuss Tennessee's nuclear renaissance, workforce development, policy frameworks, and how reliable baseload nuclear power can support emerging energy demands, including from technology sectors like Bitcoin mining and AI/HPC.

column7: Bridging Policy, Academia, and Industry: Accelerating Nuclear Energy Innovation
column9: How Do Open Source Innovations Change Mining?
column15: Delve into the profound shifts open-source innovations are driving in the mining sector. Drawing from advancements in hardware design, automation software, energy optimization, heat use, and financial ecosystems, participants will examine how accessible, collaborative technologies are lowering entry barriers, boosting decentralization, and enhancing sustainability. We cover integrating waste energy sources, scalable firmware and tools, and strategies for efficient, community-driven mining in volatile markets. Learn how grassroots innovation truly impacts the entire bitcoin mining stack.

Senator Marsha Blackburn explores how deregulation in federal policy can unleash domestic energy production and support American energy independence. Drawing from her advocacy for an "all-of-the-above" strategy, she discusses lifting restrictions on production in drilling, fracking, and pipelines to reduce reliance on foreign adversaries like Russia and China. Furthermore, we explore how energy abundance and technological advancements in nuclear and biofuels support 21st Century loads loads like Bitcoin mining and AI compute. The U.S. can monetize megawatts, lower costs, create jobs, and bolster grid resilience in Tennessee and beyond.

column9: User-Centered Design: Hard Lessons in Building Hardware
column15: Dive into the principles of user-centered hardware design in this insightful fireside chat. A veteran tech builder shares lessons from crafting iconic payment terminals to innovative Bitcoin self-custody wallets and cutting-edge mining systems, demonstrating how intuitive design, seamless functionality, and modular durability empower everyday users in fintech and Bitcoin.

column9: Does All Load Matter? Where Scale Meets Impact
column15: We examine whether all forms of load, from small community microgrids to hyperscale AI clusters, actually move the needle in energy markets.  We answer whether smaller, distributed operations contribute meaningful resilience, or if scale alone drives impact. We debate the relative roles of boutique miners, industrial campuses, and emerging HPC facilities in stabilizing grids and monetizing megawatts. The discussion will challenge assumptions about size versus flexibility, exploring how different scales of demand can collectively shape our energy and compute future.

The emerging intersection of AI computing, bitcoin, and energy production presents an unknown future. Explore questions like: Will AI’s insatiable hunger for power spur a new wave of energy innovation? Do loads such as Bitcoin mining evaporate or integrate? Can we schedule intensive compute tasks around renewable availability? What responsibilities do AI companies have in grid planning and impact? The conversation will range from technical solutions in emerging next-gen chips and cooling, to big-picture ideas like 21st century loads as a driver for new power plants.

As Bitcoin mining and large loads mature, load and generation evolve from mere production and consumption into tradable financial assets. We unpack how hashrate derivatives, futures, forwards, and a tradable energy strategies, are reshaping risk and capital in mining. They’ll discuss how miners hedge revenue volatility, how traders price compute exposure, and what infrastructure is needed to scale hashrate markets. Expect candid insights into liquidity, regulation, and the path toward mainstream financialization of compute power.

column9: The State of Large Scale Miners
column15: A changing landscape is accelerating across the mining sector as public companies seek scale, efficiency, and strategic positioning. This discussion analyzes the pivots, mergers, SPACs, distressed acquisitions, bankruptcy negotiations, and cross-border expansions. We examine capital structure, regulatory friction, emerging network engagement and how the largest miners are reshaping the industry’s ownership landscape.

column9: Where Regulatory Advocacy Meets Energy Optimization
column15: This session brings together perspectives on public policy, operations, and sustainable energy practices. We will dive into best practices in navigating te regulatory landscape, implementing demand response for grid support, and pursuing clean energy commitments, highlighting the political strategies that promote industry growth, improve energy efficiency, mitigate environmental impacts, and contribute to resilient, modern power systems amid increasing computational demands.

column9: Free to Mine, Here and Abroad
column15: From U.S. statehouses to emerging markets, access to energy and regulatory certainty is uneven. We explore mining freedom domestically and internationally, from Latin America and the Middle East to Africa and Asia. We consider sanctions, capital controls, energy sovereignty, and cross-border infrastructure, and even how nation states are merging energy resources and grid demands with monetization of load.

column9: What (Technical) Problems are Left to Solve?
column15: Rapid evolution in hardware, cooling, and deployment models have solved a majority of early operational problems for Bitcoin miners, yet major technical challenges remain. This panel covers firmware optimization, grid orchestration tools, power density constraints, container reliability, AI overlap, and advanced monitoring systems to explore the technological edge of mining optimization. The focus: bottlenecks preventing the next leap in scale and performance and integration with new, alternative load types.

column9: Annual Closing Panel: What Comes Next in 2026
column15: Join us for the most recent round of the NEMS annual closing panel where we discuss the progress of the summit, the major insights and conversations that have occurred, and the exciting new vision for 2026.

column9: Tennessee as the Leader in American Energy
column15: Explore Tennessee's ascent as America's energy powerhouse in this dynamic discussion. Delving into pro-domestic production policies, nuclear innovation, federal policy and strategies for monetizing abundant megawatts, our very own local leaders outline how reliable power fuels economic growth, attracts high-demand industries like data centers and bitcoin mining, and secures national energy independence in the heart of America for generations to come.

column9: Cultivating State and Federal Energy Strategies
column15: This policy-focused fireside highlights how state and federal policymakers lead in shaping the future of energy and digital innovation. Political builders will share perspectives on pioneering energy frameworks, and the growing role in advanced compute and industry investment. They explore how state-level strategies, from regulatory clarity to infrastructure incentives, cultivate innovation, attract capital, and balance economic growth with responsible governance, setting the example for national and international policy development.

column9: When is the Miner Death Spiral?
Mining for the Next Century: Which Models Survive.
